6x15: 28 Pranks Later

c a b

The scene in the throne room places this after Castle Sweet Castle. The CMC have their cutie marks. The cake Rainbow purchases for a prank has to cost a lot and makes me think this should follow Newbie Dash, after which her income would have increased. At the same time, Rainbow’s huge cloud mansion she lives alone in suggests she has always been a lady of means.

Many of the pranks perpetrated by Rainbow require a teleport-capable unicorn to pull off, which suggests Starlight Glimmer was involved, and would imply this episode has to follow The Cutie Re-Mark – but that would also contradict the appearance of the Cake Twins.

The Cake twins are in diapers, which places this episode before Hearth’s Warming Tail, in which they are out of them.

7x13: The Perfect Pear

c a b

This episode is highly chronologically disconnected, and mostly consists of flashbacks. However, it makes the more sense the earlier it happens, as the further it is in the future, the more silly the whole mystery of the Apple Parents becomes. The only hard lower bound on this episode so far identified is Apple Bloom’s cutie mark.

In The One Where Pinkie Pie Knows, Applejack observes her own birth certificate. Such a document would be entirely meaningless if it did not contain at the very least the full name of her mother, however, we also know that up until this episode, Applejack only knew her mother as “Buttercup”. At the same time, Goldie Delicious insists that “Buttercup” was just a nickname, and leaves no options for Pear Butter to have had it legally changed upon marriage. It follows that this episode has to precede The One Where Pinkie Pie Knows, and there are no locks preventing this – but this itself is not a hard lock, because we can still believe Goldie Delicious is getting senile.

This episode introduces Grand Pear, who is another minor chronology marker – due to being voiced by William Shatner, he is unlikely to make many appearances, but he does turn up in the background afterwards.
Must follow:
  • 5x18: Crusaders of the Lost Mark
Must precede:
  • 5x19: The One Where Pinkie Pie Knows
Could precede:
  • j 5x19: The One Where Pinkie Pie Knows

5x19: The One Where Pinkie Pie Knows

c a b

A pool/lake birthday party for Shady Daze implies summer, when playing in water is desirable. Cadance is pregnant with Flurry Heart, and yet it’s not showing at all. The Cake Twins are approximately 20% smaller than they are in A Hearth’s Warming Tail, are out of diapers, (which would imply that 28 Pranks Later didn’t actually happen later…) but are still using pacifiers.

Flurry Heart being born sets an upper bound on this, and I’m not going to believe pony pregnancies taking over a year – so there is a rubber band between this episode and the Crystalling, which can’t be longer than 12 months and shouldn’t be shorter than five or so.
Must follow:

This episode would make more sense if it occurred before What about Discord? rather than after, since it can serve as an effective missing link showing how he befriended the Mane 5.

We see very, very little of Equestria in this movie at all, but at the end Twilight appears and references the events of The Cutie Re-Mark about as explicitly as it was possible without being an outright spoiler, and mentions that they have just occurred. As such, it has to happen strictly between The Cutie Re-Mark and The Crystalling, because in the latter episode Twilight leaves for an extended trip to the Crystal Empire.

6x01-02: The Crystalling

b

Starlight Glimmer behaves like this is her first morning in Twilight’s castle, or at least, the first week, which implies that the Cutie Re-Mark happened very recently, and the montage at the end of that episode covers future events. It is, at the very least, her first official friendship lesson.

Flurry Heart is a newborn, at most a few days old, which implies a pregnancy period has to have elapsed since The One Where Pinkie Pie Knows.

Crystal Empire clearly has winter, or very early spring, – there is no evidence to suppose Crystal Empire is capable of the same total weather control as most of Equestria – seeing as how it’s about to freeze over the moment the Heart is broken. (There are episodes where the snow is not observable around the Crystal Empire at all, so it definitely does have seasonal changes.) Ponyville area, however, has green grass, which only leaves spring as the possible season.

Tertiary canon (Princess Cadance and the Spring Hearts Garden) also claims Flurry Heart was born in winter or early spring.

All of that cannot occur earlier than the start of the spring of the second year, because Twilight does not have wings during the entire first winter.
Must follow:
  • 3x13: Magical Mystery Cure
  • 5x19: The One Where Pinkie Pie Knows
  • 5x25-26: The Cutie Re-Mark
  • SM2-SP: Spring, Year 2

6x03: The Gift of the Maud Pie

c a b

Rarity has met Maud already. This explicitly precedes the opening of her boutique in Manehattan, which happens in Saddle Row Review.
Must follow:
  • 4x18: Maud Pie
Must precede:
  • 6x09: The Saddle Row Review

6x04: On Your Marks

c a b

This episode explicitly starts with the first meeting of the CMC after they acquired their marks. No matter how many other obligations they have in their daily lives, this has to have happened within a month after Crusaders of the Lost Mark.
Must follow:
  • 1x09: Bridle Gossip
  • 3x13: Magical Mystery Cure
  • 5x18: Crusaders of the Lost Mark

6x05: Gauntlet of Fire

c a d b

This is a very floaty episode, most of which occurs in unexplored dragon lands, and the only clear marker we get is that the Friendship Castle exists. Pretty much nopony you would expect to see in there is present. The season in Ponyville is never clearly seen.

Princess Spike is unlikely to happen after this episode, since Spike gets a confidence boost and a new friend in the process, but that’s about it for the observable soft bounds.
Must follow:
  • 3x13: Magical Mystery Cure
  • 5x01-02: The Cutie Map
  • 5x10: Princess Spike
Could follow:
  • j 5x10: Princess Spike

7x12: Discordant Harmony

c a b

This episode is highly chronologically disconnected. None of the usual markers appear, and it can conceivably occur at any time after Keep Calm and Flutter On. However, for character development progression reasons, it probably occurs after Make New Friends But Keep Discord,.
Must follow:
  • 3x10: Keep Calm and Flutter On
  • 5x07: Make New Friends but Keep Discord
Could follow:
  • j 5x07: Make New Friends but Keep Discord

6x06: No Second Prances

c a b

Starlight Glimmer is a friendship student for long enough not to bump into things, but most other markers we get in this episode are clearly redundant.

Among other things, Rainbow Dash offers to introduce Starlight Glimmer to Spitfire, which is somewhat unlikely before Newbie Dash, and probably has to happen a significant time afterwards. However, in Newbie Dash, Spitfire addresses Rainbow on friendly terms already, so this is a matter of argument.

This episode introduces the Starlight/Trixie partnership, requiring all further episodes in which they interact to occur afterwards.
Must follow:
  • 3x05: Magic Duel
  • 3x13: Magical Mystery Cure
  • 5x25-26: The Cutie Re-Mark
  • 6x01-02: The Crystalling
Could follow:
  • i 6x07: Newbie Dash

6x07: Newbie Dash

c a b

Rainbow Dash is officially a Wonderbolt as of this episode, so every time she expresses the desire to become one has to occur before, and every time she mentions that she is one has to occur after, making Flutter Brutter the upper bound and Rarity Investigates the closest lower bound. But this episode can occur before the Cutie Re-Mark, and probably should.
Must follow:
  • 3x13: Magical Mystery Cure
  • 5x15: Rarity Investigates!
  • 5x18: Crusaders of the Lost Mark
Must precede:
  • 6x11: Flutter Brutter

6x09: The Saddle Row Review

a

The episode is set during Fashion Week, whenever that is, and therefore has to occur an integer amount of years after Rarity Takes Manehattan, and you would expect it to occur no more than a couple of months after The Gift of the Maud Pie. Coco Pommel shows up.

This episode also explicitly states the season: According to Rarity, “tonight is the last night of the Fall season.” Fashion’s “fall season” need not explicitly fall on calendar season boundaries, but it pretty definitely has to be in autumn, and it has to be at least the second year’s autumn.
Must follow:
  • 3x13: Magical Mystery Cure
  • 4x08: Rarity Takes Manehattan
  • 6x03: The Gift of the Maud Pie
  • 6x09: The Saddle Row Review
  • SM2-AU: Autumn, Year 2

6x10: Applejack's "Day" Off

c a b

There are few of the usual markers in this one, even the Friendship Castle never shows up, and the moons aren’t helping any. But Rainbow Dash refers to “Wonderbolt practice,” which hard locks this episode to follow Newbie Dash. The cold open scene is separated from the rest of the episode by at least a few “moons.”
Must follow:
  • 3x13: Magical Mystery Cure
  • 6x07: Newbie Dash

6x11: Flutter Brutter

c a b

The events depicted in this episode stretch across a substantial time period, but must follow Fluttershy saving Equestria at least twice, Twilight getting the Castle and putting up roots, and Rainbow Dash becoming a Wonderbolt.

For the purposes of this chronology, we’re referring to “the events of this episode” being the sequence when Zephyr Breeze returns to Ponyville, as we cannot reliably date the other sequences.

Pinkie’s wallet contains pictures of Moondancer, Cranky Doodle, Cheese Sandwich, and Iron Will, and she also mentions Mrs. Harshwhinny, requiring certain episodes to precede and producing the only known hard bound on Putting Your Hoof Down.
Must follow:
  • 2x18: A Friend in Deed
  • 2x19: Putting Your Hoof Down
  • 3x11-12: Just for Sidekicks / Games Ponies Play
  • 3x13: Magical Mystery Cure
  • 4x12: Pinkie Pride
  • 5x03: Castle Sweet Castle
  • 5x12: Amending Fences
  • 6x07: Newbie Dash

6x12: Spice Up Your Life

c a b

This is a Cutie Map mission, and is explicitly referred to as being the first mission since Starlight broke the map in the Cutie Re-Mark.
Must follow:
  • 3x13: Magical Mystery Cure
  • 5x25-26: The Cutie Re-Mark
  • 6x01-02: The Crystalling

6x13: Stranger than Fan Fiction

c a d b

At no point we see clearly what season it is in Equestria, and most of the action happens indoors, or in barely defined jungle, where we don’t know what the seasons look like.

Twilight mentions Griffonstone, and Rainbow Dash never asks what it is, which means that it has to follow The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone. Twilight also mentions a “Friendship Summit” in there, which makes me think that at least some time has to have passed since Rainbow observed it as a hellhole, but we can’t really tell how much.

None of the other usual markers are present, and Rainbow Dash never even boasts she is a Wonderbolt despite endless occasions to do so, so this probably should be backdated before Newbie Dash.

Alternatively, it happens immediately after Top Bolt, because for most of that episode, Rainbow is excited to catch up on Daring Do with Twilight.
Must follow:
  • 3x13: Magical Mystery Cure
  • 5x08: The Lost Treasure of Griffonstone

6x14: The Cart Before the Ponies

c a b

This episode is very ambiguously placed. School is in session, the fountain has water, but almost none of the usual markers are visible, Twilight, Spike and Starlight are missing entirely and the Friendship Castle does not appear. Rainbow Dash never once is referred to as a Wonderbolt.

The banner from Rainbow Dash’s birthiversary in Pinkie Pride makes an appearance, and the CMC sport their cutie marks. This probably needs to be backdated quite far into the past.
Must follow:
  • 4x12: Pinkie Pride
  • 5x18: Crusaders of the Lost Mark

6x16: The Times they are a Changeling

c a d b

We have trouble with dating this episode seasonally, because it’s set in the Crystal Empire.

Spike explicitly mentions that this is the first trip to the Crystal Empire since The Crystalling, and at least a few months have passed since, because Twilight expects Flurry Heart to have grown.

Only Spike, Twilight and Starlight are on this trip, making it possible for this episode to occur in parallel with many other episodes of Season 6.
Must follow:
  • 6x01-02: The Crystalling

6x18: Buckball Season

c a b

This episode lacks almost all markers. Twilight, Spike, Rarity, Friendship Castle, the CMC never appear.

The only hard constraint that I can identify so far is Over a Barrel, since Applejack mentions Braeburn to Rainbow, when we know Rainbow meets him for the first time in that episode, and wouldn’t know who that is otherwise.

Griffon the Brush Off is probably a (likely redundant) soft constraint, because prior to that Rainbow Dash does not seem to like Pinkie anywhere as much as here. For similar reasons, Boast Busters is also a soft constraint, since Snails displays mastery of telekinesis that would make Trixie far less impressive to him back then if he had it.

Yes, this could fall through all the way to year 1.
Must follow:
  • 1x05: Griffon the Brush Off
  • 1x06: Boast Busters
  • 1x21: Over a Barrel
Could follow:
  • j 1x05: Griffon the Brush Off
  • j 1x06: Boast Busters

6x19: The Fault in Our Cutie Marks

c a b

Being a CMC-centric episode, this lacks most of the usual markers. It needs some time after On Your Marks for the Crusaders to acquire a reputation, but it’s not clear how much exactly.
Must follow:
  • 6x04: On Your Marks

6x20: Viva Las Pegasus

c a d b

This is a Cutie Map mission, and while Starlight never turns up, Fluttershy refers to the map possibly “being on the fritz again,” which can only refer to it being repaired in Spice Up Your Life.

We never see just what season it is on the ground, though, and weather in Las Pegasus might not match weather on the ground at all.
Must follow:
  • 5x03: Castle Sweet Castle
  • 6x12: Spice Up Your Life

6x21: Every Little Thing She Does

c a b

Twilight says that Starlight did not tackle any friendship lessons since she met Trixie. That makes it impossible for any episode which contains a friendship lesson for Starlight to come between this episode and No Second Prances, as well as positions this episode after No Second Prances.

While the typical markers for a student-Starlight time period are present, Rainbow Dash never refers to being a Wonderbolt.
Must follow:
  • 6x01-02: The Crystalling
  • 6x06: No Second Prances

6x22: P.P.O.V. (Pony Point of View)

c a b

Very few markers except the Friendship Castle itself, no observable Starlight Glimmer, no Rainbow Dash and no references to her being a Wonderbolt, and even no Cutie Mark Crusaders, so this one can float up and down quite far.
Must follow:
  • 5x01-02: The Cutie Map

6x23: Where the Apple Lies

c a b

Apple Bloom has her cutie mark, positioning this episode after Crusaders of the Lost Mark, and the present-time sequences occur after that year’s Zap Apple season, locking it into an annual relationship with Family Appreciation Day.

Otherwise, so little of this episode occurs in present day, that it does not influence any potentially neighboring episodes at all.
Must follow:
  • 2x12: Family Appreciation Day
  • 5x18: Crusaders of the Lost Mark

6x24: Top Bolt

c b

Starlight Glimmer is in attendance, Rainbow Dash is a Wonderbolt and has been one for an extended period, judging by ready recognition.

This is a Cutie Map mission, which requires this to happen after Spice Up Your Life, when Twilight and Starlight fixed the map.

Rainbow Dash is looking forward to catching up on Daring Do with Twilight, which suggests this episode occurs immediately before Stranger Than Fan Fiction, but this is not a hard boundary, because there’s an unspecified “Wonderbolt emergency” at the end of the episode, which may or may not prevent this. Unless it was, in fact, a prank, which it could be.

Rainbow Dash has just completed “spring training,” which fixes the season to spring or summer. Since we have a fixed season, indirectly this produces a hard lower bound against spring of year 2, which is probably redundant.
Must follow:
  • 6x12: Spice Up Your Life
  • SM2-SP: Spring, Year 2

EG4: Equestria Girls: Legends of Everfree

c a d b

The Pony Movie With No Ponies In It.

We can basically say nothing about the chronological position of this movie, except that it follows the previous one. We never see what season is it in Equestria, and we don’t even know whether the time flows at the same rate on both sides of the portal – there are very good reasons to believe it does not – so that doesn’t give us anything.
Must follow:
  • EG3: Equestria Girls: Friendship Games

Summer, Year 3

c

Summer of year 3 of the series starts.
Must follow:
  • SM2-SP: Spring, Year 2

7x23: Secrets and Pies

c a b

Friendship Castle is in evidence, but Starlight is not, and the CMC do not appear. Rarity, likewise, does not appear, which makes it possible for this episode to occur within the Punk Rarity period.

Rainbow Dash is a Wonderbolt, and the episode starts with Pinkie celebrating her 73rd training session. We don’t know how often do the Wonderbolts have training sessions, but later statements in the episode imply it’s definitely not more often than six times per week. A more reasonable guess seems to be three training sessions per week, in which case, this episode is six months away from Newbie Dash. Other statements within the episode imply at least three months.

Vapor Trail and Sky Stinger appear in trainee outfits, requiring Top Bolt to have happened prior.

During the episode, Pinkie refers to a pie she made for Rainbow’s birthday. Flashback shows a party with the banner that was made for her birthiversary in Pinkie Pride, and a tank which looks suspiciously like Cheese Sandwich’s party tank. If this is the same tank, this would require this episode to be no more than a year away from Pinkie Pride. However, Cheese Sandwich’s tank had tracks, while the one depicted in this flashback has wheels. As such, it’s inconclusive.

Cheerilee refers to pies Rainbow keeps donating to the school on her half-birthday, “for years.” Since we know that Pinkie and Rainbow were not friends before Summer 1, it implies that at least three years have passed since Summer 1.
Must follow:
  • 4x12: Pinkie Pride
  • 6x01-02: The Crystalling
  • 6x07: Newbie Dash
  • 6x24: Top Bolt
  • SM3-SU: Summer, Year 3
Could follow:
  • j SM3-SU: Summer, Year 3

7x05: Fluttershy Leans In

c a b

This is one of those disconnected episodes.

Friendship Castle does not appear on screen, but Starlight does, setting this to after the Crystalling. The CMC sport their cutie marks.

The events of The Hooffelds and McColts are referred to.

While there might be a case for making a lot of hard or soft constraints against early Fluttershy episodes, almost all of these would be redundant, with the possible exception of Putting Your Hoof Down, which can’t happen after this show of assertiveness by Fluttershy.
Must follow:
  • 2x19: Putting Your Hoof Down
  • 5x18: Crusaders of the Lost Mark
  • 5x23: The Hooffields and McColts
  • 6x01-02: The Crystalling

7x20: A Health of Information

c a b

The usual markers for the Starlight-Student period are present – Twilicorn and Friendship Castle are in evidence. Starlight herself, however, is notably absent, even though we are certain she is already a student: Fluttershy references the Sweet Feather Sanctuary she has created in Fluttershy Leans In, while Starlight participated in its construction. Starlight is definitely away from the castle for whatever reason, at that.

This episode does not feature any major characters other than Twilight, Fluttershy, Zecora and Spike, and can coincide with several other episodes. It occupies these four for anywhere between three days and, presumably, a week.
Must follow:
  • 6x01-02: The Crystalling
  • 7x05: Fluttershy Leans In

Autumn, Year 3

a

Autumn of year 3 of the series starts.
Must follow:
  • SM3-SU: Summer, Year 3

7x03: A Flurry of Emotions

c a b

Being an episode centered on Flurry Heart interacting with Twilight, this episode has to follow The Crystalling, where Twilight saw her for the first time.

Friendship Castle, Flurry Heart are in evidence, but Starlight isn’t. Trixie and Sunburst are not present either, even though normally, Sunburst would be the prime candidate for this job if Shining Armor and Cadance wanted some time off. Their reason they give for presence in Ponyville sounds rather dubious, given the lack of interest in modern art they demonstrate. To Where and Back Again is not a hard bound on this episode, either below or above. Where it is placed in the timeline depends primarily on its temporal relationship to the birthday of Flurry Heart, and other episodes will have to happen around it.

By my estimates, based on observed level of development, Flurry Heart has to be between 6 and 9 months old at this point. Twilight has accumulated at least 15 different pre-packaged gifts for Flurry, which, depending on the rate she accumulated them, would imply she hasn’t had a chance to bestow them on Flurry for at least a few months. At the same time, multiple extended instances of spending time together had to occur in the past for Flurry to get so attached to Twilight.

School is in session, because the sick foals got sick on a school picture day, and I suspect this implies that this is autumn, probably early autumn.
Must follow:
  • 6x01-02: The Crystalling

7x22: Once Upon a Zeppelin

c a b

This episode lacks most markers, except the existence of Flurry Heart, and has no clear references to recent past events otherwise. Though it does put an unexpected upper limit on Putting Your Hoof Down, due to the reappearance of Iron Will, this limit is not very useful even if it isn’t actually redundant.

While Flurry’s general level of development appears to match the one seen in A Flurry of Emotions, we can’t conclusively say if it happens before or after.
Must follow:
  • 2x19: Putting Your Hoof Down
  • 6x01-02: The Crystalling
Could follow:
  • i 7x03: A Flurry of Emotions

7x10: A Royal Problem

c a b

This episode is all about student-era Starlight, and thus has to happen after she became one. This is also a Cutie Map mission, so it must happen after the map was repaired.

There are, however, no clear hard markers that would allow to date it beyond that, as Starlight never refers to Trixie or Maud, nor anything else that could have placed it more precisely, and my hunch is that it should go before To Where and Back Again rather than after.
Must follow:
  • 6x01-02: The Crystalling
  • 6x12: Spice Up Your Life

6x25-26: To Where and Back Again

c a b

Starlight is friends with Trixie already, which places this after No Second Prances, and it features Thorax, which places it after The Times they are a Changeling.

There is no clear indication just what season a “Sunset Festival” would happen in, but autumn seems more likely. However, this is the only case when the trees around Starlight’s village have blooms on them, which would suggest spring instead.

Incidentally, the tactically easiest way to kidnap Cadance, Shining Armor and Flurry Heart is not to do this in the Crystal Empire, but rather, when they’re traveling back home from their visit to Twilight that occurs in A Flurry of Emotions – which is why I’m placing it immediately prior: A Flurry of Emotions can occur during the time Starlight and Trixie travel on hoof to Starlight’s village and travel back, which would explain Starlight’s absence during that episode rather well, and make the overwhelmingly successful kidnapping of every princess in Equestria by Chrysalis a little less dubious.

If that theory is correct, though, the Mane 5 are getting kidnapped while Twilight is playing with Flurry Heart…

Starlight’s cottage in Our Town has been torn down and replaced by a tree at some point, so there’s a redundant hard lock against The Cutie Re-Mark.
Must follow:
  • 5x25-26: The Cutie Re-Mark
  • 6x01-02: The Crystalling
  • 6x06: No Second Prances
  • 6x16: The Times they are a Changeling

7x01: A Celestial Advice

c a b

This episode unambiguously follows To Where and Back Again very closely, with no more than a week between them, as the events of that are the entire reason the episode plot even exists.

The events of Gauntlet of Fire are referred to, making it another lower bound.
Must follow:
  • 6x05: Gauntlet of Fire
  • 6x25-26: To Where and Back Again

7x02: All Bottled Up

c a b

While it does look like All Bottled Up is meant to follow A Celestial Advice very closely, it actually might not follow it at all, but rather be in front of it. The events of To Where and Back Again are referred to, however.
Must follow:
  • 6x06: No Second Prances
  • 6x25-26: To Where and Back Again

7x04: Rock Solid Friendship

c a

Friendship Castle and student-Starlight are in evidence.

This is explicitly Maud’s first visit to Ponyville since the moment Friendship Castle grew, and establishes that she did not visit the town at least since before Twilight’s Kingdom. This indirectly establishes a redundant upper bound on Maud Pie.

The cave first seen in Gauntlet of Fire makes an appearance and suffers significant remodeling, requiring this episode to occur afterwards.

Rarity mentions working on an order for Countess Coloratura, requiring this episode to occur after their introduction to each other.

This can’t happen before The Gift of the Maud Pie, since Maud does not yet have her rocktorate there.

Trixie was explicitly the first friend Starlight made beside the Mane 6, so this can’t happen earlier than No Second Prances and Every Little Thing She Does, because it undeniably contains a friendship lesson, and no friendship lesson for Starlight can occur between these two episodes. In addition, Starlight and Pinkie’s reaction to the line “It’s not like she enslaved anypony lately” suggests that Every Little Thing She Does actually happened very recently.

There are no mentions of Starlight saving the day whatsoever, so we can’t position this episode around To Where and Back Again with any certainty.

Market selling canned preserves makes it unlikely for this episode to happen in spring.

This is a landmark episode: Maud completes her rocktorate and moves to the cave near Ponyville, requiring any episode that features her as a denizen of Ponyville to follow. We don’t know yet if any will follow, but some might.
Must follow:
  • 5x24: The Mane Attraction
  • 6x01-02: The Crystalling
  • 6x03: The Gift of the Maud Pie
  • 6x05: Gauntlet of Fire
  • 6x06: No Second Prances
  • 6x21: Every Little Thing She Does

7x07: Parental Glideance

c a b

Rainbow Dash is a Wonderbolt, so Newbie Dash has come and gone. Numerous other episodes relating to Rainbow’s long road to become a Wonderbolt are referred to, but since they are all also prerequisites for Newbie Dash, they’re redundant.

While most of the other obvious markers like Starlight or the Friendship Castle are missing, Sky Stinger and Vapor Trail turn up in Wonderbolt trainee uniforms, requiring this episode to follow Top Bolt.
Must follow:
  • 6x07: Newbie Dash
  • 6x24: Top Bolt

7x09: Honest Apple

c a b

Apple Bloom has her cutie mark, however, we don’t see Twilicorn or Starlight or the Friendship Castle. We do see Photo Finish and Hoity Toity again, but the presence of Apple Bloom’s mark makes marking their episodes redundant.

Pinkie Pie mentions Sassy Saddles as a potential contest judge, which requires Canterlot Boutique to exist.

Spike mentions Coloratura as a potential contest judge, which he wouldn’t do unless Rarity was already acquainted with her, which requires The Mane Attraction to have happened.

Hoity Toity refers to “Miss Pommel’s debut in Manehattan last week.” This could have happened both before and after the opening of Rarity’s Manehattan boutique, but is more likely to have happened after.
Must follow:
  • 5x14: Canterlot Boutique
  • 5x18: Crusaders of the Lost Mark
  • 5x24: The Mane Attraction
  • 6x09: The Saddle Row Review
Could follow:
  • j 6x09: The Saddle Row Review

7x14: Fame and Misfortune

c b

We could cite a lot of redundant markers here, since multiple Season 4 events are referenced by the Journal of Friendship indirectly, however, the presence of Starlight in the Friendship Castle results in just one hard lower bound identified so far – The Crystalling.

Apple Bloom references the as of yet unaired episode Marks and Recreation as happening in a reasonably near future, which introduces an implicit seasonal position for this episode – it can only happen in a spring or summer of the same year that Marks and Recreation will be dated to.
Must follow:
  • 6x01-02: The Crystalling

7x21: Marks and Recreation

c

The cold open part of this episode explicitly precedes Fame and Misfortune, since that is when the CMC get the idea to have this camp, however, the rest of the episode explicitly follows it, since Apple Bloom refers to it as an upcoming event therein. This reference also rigidly times this episode to a summer. For the purposes of this chronology, the cold open is not part of the episode proper.

Thunderlane is revealed as a Wonderbolt, when the last time we heard of him in relation to the Wonderbolts, he was a reservist. It appears quite unlikely that he became one before Rainbow Dash did, which would require this episode to follow Newbie Dash, but is not a hard lock. Wonderbolts Academy, however, is one, though it is redundant.

The location for this day camp is “Camp Friendship,” explicitly the one where Applejack met Coloratura, but while this implies that it’s probable that this episode follows the Mane Attraction, since that would bring the location to Apple Bloom’s attention, it is likewise, not a hard lock.
Must follow:
  • 3x07: Wonderbolts Academy
  • 5x24: The Mane Attraction
  • 6x07: Newbie Dash
  • 7x14: Fame and Misfortune
Could follow:
  • j 5x24: The Mane Attraction
  • j 6x07: Newbie Dash

7x15: Triple Threat

c a b

Featuring the newtype Thorax, this episode needs to happen after Thorax has acquired this state – and since it would be quite silly for the events described here to happen before A Celestial Advice, which happens immediately afterwards, the hard lock is against that, instead of To Where and Back Again.

Ember likewise introduces a hard lock against Gauntlet of Fire, which is probably redundant.

The use of the “Official Friendship Ambassador” title for Spike introduces a soft lock against Not Asking For Trouble, which is where, as far as we’re aware, the idea of such a post is first coined.

Thorax references To Change a Changeling as an upcoming event.
Must follow:
  • 6x05: Gauntlet of Fire
  • 7x01: A Celestial Advice
  • 7x11: Not Asking for Trouble
Must precede:
  • 7x17: To Change a Changeling
Could follow:
  • j 7x11: Not Asking for Trouble

7x16: Campfire Tales

c a b

This episode is primarily devoted to stories which have no direct relevance to current events, but it is, nevertheless, dated pretty strictly: It is an annual camping trip, the tradition of which was started in Sleepless in Ponyville. That episode is referenced quite explicitly, producing an anniversary lock between seasons 3 and 7.

The spoken lines leave some room for interpretation, but they rather heavy-handedly imply that this is the first such trip since Sleepless in Ponyville that the entire six-sister team attends. If you don’t accept that, you have to accept that torturing Scootaloo with scary stories is a multi-year tradition, so pick whichever option you hate the least.

At the same time, since both of these episodes do not have a lot of hard dependencies so far, this is not as constraining as it could be.
Must follow:
  • 3x06: Sleepless in Ponyville
  • 5x18: Crusaders of the Lost Mark

7x17: To Change a Changeling

c a d b

We know nothing about what season it is in Ponyville, since this episode does not include any scenes there. While the seasons did seem similar in To Where and Back Again, they do not have to be synchronized.

This episode was directly referenced in Triple Threat, wherein Thorax mentioned the problem he has with renegade changelings – referred to as completely newtyped before this story – and his brother. For obvious reasons, there’s also a redundant hard lock against A Celestial Advice.

Trixie attempts to teleport – which she is known to have been unable to do at all prior to the events of All Bottled Up. Even though she fails, she wouldn’t even consider this an option before that.
Must follow:
  • 7x01: A Celestial Advice
  • 7x02: All Bottled Up
  • 7x15: Triple Threat

7x18: Daring Done

c a b

This episode is very disconnected: All the usual markers, even the CMC cutie marks, are not in evidence.

It can’t happen before Daring Don’t, because otherwise Rainbow Dash and Pinkie would not know where Daring Do lives, however, that’s the only limitation – Stranger than Fan Fiction is not a constraint on this, and the relationship between Rainbow and Daring did not change as a result of that episode anyway.

Other remarks, like the mention of the parasprite infestation in Fillydelphia, suggest it could be a very early episode.
Must follow:
  • 4x04: Daring Don't

Winter, Year 3

d

Winter of year 3 of the series starts.
Must follow:
  • SM3-AU: Autumn, Year 3

6x08: A Hearth's Warming Tail

d

Starlight feels more or less at home in the Friendship Castle, so a substantial time has to have passed since the Crystalling.

My hunch is that Starlight has become a friendship student sometime in spring or summer of a year that includes events all the way to the To Where and Back Again and accompanying episodes. This is further supported by the observation that Starlight treats Twilight more like an equal than a teacher than in many subsequently aired episodes.

The one snag for this interpretation is the absence of Trixie, but the scenes of Best Gift Ever imply that she tours Equestria during the holiday season.

It is impossible for this story to be the Hearth’s Warming of year 1, since Twilight clearly did not have wings yet during that one. It is likewise impossible for this story to happen on Hearth’s Warming of year 2, unless Hearthbreakers happens in the winter of the year 3 somehow, which would be incredibly odd. This makes the winter of year 2 a hard lower bound and the winter of year 3 a soft one.
Must follow:
  • 3x13: Magical Mystery Cure
  • 5x18: Crusaders of the Lost Mark
  • 5x25-26: The Cutie Re-Mark
  • 6x01-02: The Crystalling
  • SM2-WI: Winter, Year 2
  • SM3-WI: Winter, Year 3
Could follow:
  • j SM3-WI: Winter, Year 3

Spring, Year 3

b

Spring of year 3 of the series starts.
Must follow:
  • SM3-WI: Winter, Year 3

7x06: Forever Filly

b

Sassy Saddles’ statement that they’re having a winter to spring transition in terms of fashion lines fixes the season of this episode to spring. Despite some apples being present in the trees around the CMC clubhouse, that’s what it has to be, and probably, it has to be very early in that spring. This cannot be the spring of year 1, but it still can be the spring of year 2.

Rarity cannot remember when was the last time she hung out with Sweetie Belle, which means that at least The Cart Before The Ponies has to be rather far away in the past.

This episode references numerous other episodes of Season 6 primarily by means of a wall of photos, serving as an upper bound for them.

Rarity mentions she runs three shops, placing it after the opening of her Manehattan boutique.

Rarity orders her stones rather than digs for them herself, and it’s possible to make a case this episode has to follow Rock Solid Friendship.
Must follow:
  • 5x18: Crusaders of the Lost Mark
  • 6x04: On Your Marks

Could follow:
  • i 7x04: Rock Solid Friendship

7x08: Hard to Say Anything

c a b

Most of the episode happens in Our Town and most of the usual major markers are not visible. The blooms in trees and bushes suggest spring, but the season is not defined clearly in spoken lines.

There is a hard lock against The Cutie Re-Mark, because, even though Starlight is neither present nor is conclusively referred to as a friend, her cottage in Our Town has already been torn down.

The dialogue between Sweetie Belle and Scootaloo regarding the words “when I was younger” may be interpreted as a reference to the events of Forever Filly, but is far too ambiguous to be a solid hard lock. It is also somewhat unlikely that the picture of Big Mac and Cherilee together would still hang in the CMC Clubhouse as seen in Forever Filly after the events of this episode.

Big Mac and Sugar Belle are established as special someponies, which should become a solid marker, but probably won’t.

7x19: It Isn't the Mane Thing About You

c a b

The usual markers for the Starlight-Student period are present – Twilicorn, Starlight, Friendship Castle are in evidence.

In the background, we see Apple Bloom chatting with Burnt Oak, and Granny Smith is hanging out with Grand Pear, setting this after the Apple Parents reveal.

Big Mac can be seen hanging out with Sugar Belle in one of the shots, requiring this relationship to already be a thing.

During this episode, Pinkie Pie celebrates “an anniversary of the first sneeze” of the Cake Twins. This should not be far behind their actual birthdays, requiring this episode to be located between 11 and 23 months away from Baby Cakes.

As a result of this episode, Rarity spends at least a month, and possibly longer, sporting the punk look, which would require any episode showing her usual hairstyle to happen after the conclusion of this period.
Must follow:
  • 2x13: Baby Cakes
  • 6x01-02: The Crystalling

7x24-26: Uncommon Bond / Shadow Play

c a b

Due to the fact that the episodes directly flow into each other – Shadow Play explicitly starts the moment Sunburst gets a chance to return from the Crystal Empire with the book he found in the blind buy barrel in Ponyville in the end of Uncommon Bond – it is best to treat this block chronologically as a three-part episode. While a gap of about a day is possible, it’s highly unlikely an episode can squeeze in it.

Typical markers for Starlight-student era are present.

Trixie is Starlight’s friend, and already knows the spell to turn objects into teacups, which requires All Bottled Up to have happened.

Maud reappears as a denizen of a Ponyville-adjacent cave, so Rock Solid Friendship happened already.

Ember is mentioned as the ruling Dragon Lord. Spike refers to himself as the official friendship ambassador to the dragons, omitting the qualifier “new” that he used during Triple Threat, which implies that Triple Threat precedes this episode, but is not a hard lock.

Campfire Tales would make precious little sense following this episode, after the Mane 6 have met the heroes they were telling stories about.

A Health of Information is referenced directly, as Fluttershy knows where to obtain Meadowbrook’s mask. Likewise, Pinkie knows where to look for Somnambula’s blindfold, because she’s been there during Daring Done.

Petunia Paleo reappears as an apprentice archaeologist, requiring the episode where the nature of her cutie mark is discerned to precede.

Pinkie Pie demonstrates the dirty original Friendship Journal instead of her clean copy made in Fame and Misfortune, suggesting that this three-parter might actually precede the publication of the journal.

Judging by Starlight’s anxiety to meet Sunburst, a substantial time has to have passed since their last meeting.

Rarity sports her regular mane, which requires this episode to avoid the multiple-month gap within It Isn’t the Mane Thing About You.
Must follow:

EGMM: Equestria Girls: Mirror Magic

c a d b

The magical powers of the Humane 7 position this special strictly after the Legends of Everfree.

Starlight is a friendship student, which requires The Cutie Re-Mark to have completed, and seeing how comfortable she is in the castle, I would say that The Crystalling also needs to have completed, but that one isn’t a hard lock.

Starlight is still a student, rather than a graduate, so it definitely precedes A Celestial Advice.

This special occurs during a Cutie Map mission that definitely was never televised, which included Twilight and at least two other ponies – so unfortunately we can’t put it into a more precise correspondence with the Equestrian timeline purely on its own contents.

We never actually see the season in Equestria, either.

EGFF: Equestria Girls: Forgotten Friendship

c a b

The magic powers of the Humane 7 set this after Legends of Everfree.

It’s difficult to estimate when exactly in the Pedestrian year it happens, but it’s definitely the fourth year of high school for the Humane 7, and it can’t be too late or too early in the year for an ocean swim, so it limits the months significantly, depending on how far south the Pedestrian city is.

There is actually very little to date this episode on the Equestrian side, directly or indirectly: Starlight never appears, so it can’t be put in a solid relation to Mirror Magic, no direct mentions of prior post-Legends of Everfree specials occur, and all that remains is the Friendship Castle, which would be there anyway, since it predates Rainbow Rocks. The only known upper bound is the throne room of Canterlot Castle, which has the pre-movie look.
Must follow:
  • EG4: Equestria Girls: Legends of Everfree
  • EGMM: Equestria Girls: Mirror Magic
Must precede:
  • MLP1: My Little Pony Movie

MLP1: My Little Pony Movie

c a b

The movie is a chronological watershed. Every episode of Season 8 that possibly could either relied on School Daze, which wastes no time acknowledging the movie, or referenced the movie independently. It introduces numerous locations, objects, and sapient races which are referenced often from there on.

At the same time, the requisite changes in the throne room of the Canterlot Castle, seen in every episode of Season 8 featuring this throne room and first appearing in this movie, position it squarely after the events of Shadow Play, where the throne room still has the appearance it had for the first seven seasons, as well as after every other appearance of the original throne room.

While it’s clear the movie was meant to be positioned between Seasons 7 and 8, individual episodes may cross this barrier anyway: the throne room is the only truly solid marker, and it does not appear anywhere as often as it could.
Must follow:
  • 2x01-02: The Return of Harmony
  • 3x01-02: The Crystal Empire
  • 4x25-26: Twilight's Kingdom

  • 7x10: A Royal Problem

EGSB: Equestria Girls: Spring Breakdown

c a b

The magic powers of the Humane 7 set this after Legends of Everfree.

According to numerous statements within, this is spring break. However, we cannot put Pedestrian spring in a strict correspondence with Equestrian seasons, we just know that the action in Equestria does not occur during a winter.

In Equestria, the victory over the Storm King is a major plot point. At the same time, in at least one shot, the School of Friendship should be visible, but isn’t, implying it has not been constructed yet. , and Spike doesn’t have wings either.

8x01-02: School Daze

c a b

This two-parter does everything to acknowledge My Little Pony The Movie as canon, and contains copious references to events of the movie, as well as entities introduced in the movie.

At the same time, while it clearly wants to stick the movie between Season 7 and Season 8, it permits us no clear way to identify just how much time has passed between them.

School of Friendship first appears in this episode, and becomes a marker for most of the episodes of Season 8, including those that would be much better off outside it.

We do not know just how long did the school spend in its temporarily shutdown state, so some episodes might squeeze in between the beginning and the ending of this episode, as it has to have taken a considerable time for Twilight to rewrite the curriculum and for all the requisite trips to take place.

Indirectly, this episode produces an upper bound on a number of earlier episodes that feature the Friendship Castle in shots which preclude the existence of the Friendship School beside it.
Must follow:
  • 4x25-26: Twilight's Kingdom

This episode introduces Mudbriar, who is a chronological marker – any episode in which Mudbriar and Pinkie interact has to follow.

Maud lives in Ponyville, requiring Rock Solid Friendship to have happened.

8x15: The Hearth's Warming Club

d

It’s a Hearth’s Warming episode, and thus is strictly seasonally locked and has integer year boundaries, but that was obvious. Otherwise, this episode is a chronology problem, because it establishes the following:

  • This is the first winter the Student Six spend in Ponyville.
  • School year runs through the winter with two weeks off for the holidays. It does not start in winter.
  • Indirectly, this also has to be the first winter Spike had his wings, i.e Molt Down has happened. If only we knew for sure which winter it is!

See where this is going?

The sequence with the changeling attempting to celebrate Hearth’s Warming weakly implies that To Where and Back Again happened between exactly one and two years away from this episode.

Cozy Glow appears in the background, producing a soft lock.

  • 8x12: Marks for Effort

  • j 8x12: Marks for Effort

8x22: What Lies Beneath

c a b

School of Friendship exists.

Spike does not appear, so we don’t know if he has wings or not.

Cozy Glow appears, and this time it’s definitely a hard lock, contingent on the events of Marks for Effort.
Must follow:
  • 8x01-02: School Daze
  • 8x12: Marks for Effort

8x23: Sounds of Silence

c a b

School of Friendship does not feature in the plot, but turns up on screen first thing in the morning. Spike does not turn up, and neither do his wings. Same about other in-Season-8 markers.

Since kirin don’t turn up and aren’t mentioned in subsequent episodes of Season 8, this could have happened more or less at any time after School Daze, and doesn’t even have a solid upper bound as of the time of writing.
Must follow:
  • 8x01-02: School Daze

8x24: Father Knows Beast

c a b

Spike has wings, and the episode opens with him flight training, which would imply Molt Down was a relatively recent, but not an immediately recent event.

The entire episode would occupy the better part of a month, if not a whole month, and would have to overlap something else. There is no solid upper bound as of the time of writing.
Must follow:
  • 8x11: Molt Down

8x25-26: School Raze

c a b

School of Friendship is the focus of the episode, Spike has wings.

This episode ends with the imprisonment of Cozy Glow, which requires every episode in which she appears as a student in the School of Friendship to happen prior, unless she gets released in Season 9 and screws up the chronology again.

Artifacts introduced in A Matter of Principals reappear.
Must follow:
  • 8x01-02: School Daze
  • 8x11: Molt Down
  • 8x12: Marks for Effort
  • 8x14: A Matter of Principals
  • 8x15: The Hearth's Warming Club
  • 8x16: Friendship University
  • 8x19: Road to Friendship
  • 8x21: A Rockhoof and a Hard Place
  • 8x22: What Lies Beneath

8xHS: Best Gift Ever

d

This is a Hearth’s Warming episode, producing the obvious seasonal locks and integer year boundaries.

School of Friendship comes up in some shots, and the Student Six are present in the episode, which requires it to happen after School Daze and also, after The Hearth’s Warming Club, which is explicitly the first winter since their arrival to Ponyville.

Spike has wings.

Mudbriar appears, very briefly. (which is a good thing.) Likewise, Sugar Belle is together with Big Mac, and Grand Pear is present in Ponyville.

The cold open of the episode features Starlight and Trixie leaving on a road trip, requiring it to happen after the Road to Friendship.

There are currently no good upper bounds.
Must follow:
  • 7x08: Hard to Say Anything
  • 7x13: The Perfect Pear
  • 8x01-02: School Daze
  • 8x03: The Maud Couple
  • 8x11: Molt Down
  • 8x15: The Hearth's Warming Club
  • 8x19: Road to Friendship

9x01-02: The Beginning of the End

c

School of Friendship is in evidence, Spike has wings, and Cozy Glow is incarcerated in Tartarus at the beginning of the episode. The Canterlot Castle throne room has the post-movie look.

According to Starlight’s statements, it is summer break, and she expected the school would be closed.
Must follow:
  • 8x11: Molt Down
  • 8x25-26: School Raze
  • MLP1: My Little Pony Movie
